results.title: Blues Clues: Blue's big treasure hunt
results.creator_credit: Angela Santomero, Todd Kessler, Traci Johnson, Wendy Harris, Nick Jr and Viacom International
results.brief_description: Popular young children’s television program. Encourages children to interact with Steve and follow Steve and his dog Blue on two treasure hunts. Promotes thinking skills such as problem solving and visual perception.

results.title: Bobe's legend
results.brief_description: Bobe’s Legend shows the artist joined in a symbiotic relationship with a young chick which, over a time-lapsed seqence, we see hatched and nurtured in the artist’s mouth until it eventually takes flight.

results.title: Bob Parish interview
results.brief_description: This interview forms part of the Sport and Screen project which will be exhibited at Screen Gallery at Federation Square. It hopes to document the oral history of the developing relationship between sport and the screen in Australia in the last half of the twentieth century. The interview with Robert (Bob) James Parish CMG, OBE is conducted by Daryl Dellora. Bob Parish was born on 7 May 1916 and played a long and distinguished part in Victorian and Australian cricket over many years. In particular he was Chairman of the Australian Cricket Board(ACB) from 1975-80 during which time a major development in international cricket took place - that of the creation of World Series Cricket(WSC). The new ‘television friendly’ game of WSC could not develop without the assistance of the ACB and it was in negotiating this relationship between the ACB and WSC that Bob Parish played a central role.

results.title: Bob and Bobek. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Bob and Bobek are two lovable white rabbits who will delight children up to the age of eight years. Their adventures are always fun and well suited to younger children who will identify with the characters and the situations in which they become involved. We follow their misadventures as they try to earn a living. In “Around the corner” they find themselves in search of a job but disaster follows their every move. A job “At the zoo” is hard work until a lion escapes. They try their hands at being removalists in “Moving”, and are left to run “The restaurant” with chaotic results. Their final attempt is to become “The rangers in the park” where they deal with a mischievious dog.

results.title: Blue mould of tobacco
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Recommended methods of controlling the Blue Mould disease which is a fungus living on tobacco plants. The disease is widespread in the Australian tobacco industry. Samples of infected plants; how it is spread; the use of benzol vapour as recommended by Research Officers; fertilizing the soil; irrigation by furrow and boom spray methods; helicopter and plane spraying; the work of the Research Laboratories which test suspected plants; and work towards breeding a blue mould resistant strain of tobacco.

results.title: Blowpipes and Bulldozers
results.creator_credit: Jeni Kendell, Paul Tait and Gala Films
results.brief_description: The story of the Penan tribe is one that is happening regularly all over the planet. It is one which we usually prefer not to know, as it deals with the potential extinction of yet another tribal culture this century. But the twist is that a Swiss man, Bruno Manser, is living and fighting with the Penan and bringing to world attention the fact that once again we of the West are allowing environmental and cultural destruction by our continuing use of rainforest timbers in our daily lives. The story of these people is moving and inspiring and one to stir your heart. Rated: G
